description: Validation legacy rules for the FAANG project. Rules are divided into one group that is applied to all experiments, and additional groups based on the experiment type. Legacy experiments have less strict metadata requirements, and should only be used for projects that existed prior to FAANGs existence that cannot be brought up to the FAANG metadata standard.  Legacy experiments will be clearly marked in the FAANG portal and it may not be possible to include them in all downstream analyses and releases
name: FAANG legacy experiment metadata rules

rules.name: read strand
rules.description: For strand specific protocol, specify which mate pair maps to the transcribed strand or Report 'non-stranded' if the protocol is not strand specific. For single-ended sequencing: use 'sense' if the reads should be on the same strand as the transcript, 'antisense' if on opposite strand. For paired-end sequencing: 'mate 1 sense' if mate 1 should be on the same strand as the transcript, 'mate 2 sense' if mate 2 should be on the same strand as the transcript

rules.name: rna integrity number
rules.description: It is important to obtain this value, but if you are unable to supply this number (e.g. due to machine failure) then by submitting you are asserting the quality by visual inspection of traces and agreeing that the samples were suitable for sequencing. For more information on RNA Integrity Numbers see Schroeder et al. (2006) http://bmcmolbiol.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/1471-2199-7-3
